org.magnos.util
Class Notifier<T>

java.lang.Object
  java.util.concurrent.CopyOnWriteArrayList<T>
      org.magnos.util.Notifier<T>
Type Parameters:
T - The element type to be proxied.
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.io.Serializable, java.lang.Cloneable, java.lang.Iterable<T>, java.lang.reflect.InvocationHandler, java.util.Collection<T>, java.util.List<T>, java.util.RandomAccess
public class Notifier<T>
extends java.util.concurrent.CopyOnWriteArrayList<T>
implements java.lang.reflect.InvocationHandler

A dynamic proxy class for notifying a list of listeners. Listeners can be added and removed from the notifier. Once methods are invoked on the proxy() object all listeners added to this notifier have the exact same method invoked with the same arguments. Proxies add approximately 500ns in overhead compared to plain invocation. The ideal environment for a Notifier consists of few modification to the listeners relative to the number of times methods on the proxy object are invoked. Another ideal aspect is infrequent use of the proxy object, a.k.a. it should not be a heavily invoked object, the overhead for using Proxies can build up when its being invoked thousands of times in a very short time. A similar aspect is the number of listeners, if there are thousands of listeners which are invoked frequently it will have the same effect as described above, excessive overhead may build up.

Example

 interface EventListener {
        public void onEvent(String event);
 }

 // instantiate
 Notifier<EventListener> listeners = Notifier.create(EventListener.class);

 // add listeners
 listeners.add(new EventListener() {
        public void onEvent(String event) {
                // event has been received.
        }
 });

 EventListener impl = ...
 listeners.add(impl);

 // notify listeners
 listeners.proxy().onEvent("Hello World");

Author:
Philip Diffenderfer
See Also:
CopyOnWriteArrayList, Serialized Form

Specified by:
invoke in interface java.lang.reflect.InvocationHandler
Throws:
java.lang.Throwable

proxy

public T proxy()
Returns the proxy object. Methods invoked on this object will in turn invoke the same method with the same arguments on the listeners and return the result of the last invokation (if any).

Returns:
The reference to the proxy object.

results

public java.util.List<java.lang.Object> results()
Returns the list of results from the last invokation to the proxy object. This list can only be safely accessed by the same thread that invoked the method on the proxy object.

Returns:
The reference to the list of results.

create

public static <T> T create(java.lang.Class<?> type)
Creates a new Notifier for the given type.

Type Parameters:
T - The notifier type.
Parameters:
type - The proxy class.
Returns:
The reference to a newly instantiated Notifier.
